title: Eddie Jones puts faith in Tom Curry and Sam Underhill to outmatch David Pocock and Michael Hooper
text:
Eddie Jones believes that ‘the battle of the breakdown’ will have an enormous impact on the outcome of Saturday’s quarter-final against Australia with particular emphasis on the tussle between the two sets of flankers.

The Wallabies have long sought to get both David Pocock and Michael Hooper on to the field at the same time, even though they are essentially openside forwards and England have copied that set-up with a desire to deploy their best assets in securing the ball at the breakdown, Tom Curry and Sam Underhill.

“It's going to be a great contest,” said Jones. “Over the last ten years Pocock has been the foremost number seven in the world while Hooper is a massively important player for...
description: Eddie Jones believes that ‘the battle of the breakdown’ will have an enormous impact on the outcome of Saturday’s quarter-final against Australia with particular emphasis on the tussle between the two sets of flankers.
